text: The Public Hearings into the draft Plan closed 19th Nov. Thank you to everyone who took part. For next steps, go to https://t.co/hkse3og4Xx
The Planning Inspectors undertook a number of accompanied  site visits today
Planning Inquiry sat for a long day yesterday covering parking, retail and conservation areas
The Planning Inquiry Hearings reopened on Tuesday https://t.co/u3KqORRJDp with a session on Local Centres which was very well attended
Published: ED's formal response to matters arising from 1st session of the public hearing into the draft IDP, go to https://t.co/u3KqORRJDp
Affordable housing will be discussed at today's hearing at Les Cotils from 9:30.  Members of the public welcome to come along to observe.
Today's Hearing sitting is cancelled as the issues in the first module were covered yesterday. The Hearings resume tomorrow 8th October.
The draft Island Development Plan Inquiry Hearings opened yesterday - http://t.co/hkse3og4Xx. Interesting and useful discussion.
Progress is good on responses to your further reps on the draft Plan & we expect to pass these to the Policy Council by the end of August
This should give time for the draft Island Development Plan to be considered and approved by the States next year.
The States have approved the extension of validity of the Urban Area Plan and Rural Area Plan until 2nd December 2016.
Thanks to all who made further representations on the draft IDP.  Responses are still being processed but we received around 350 comments.
The deadline for Further Representations on the draft Plan is 5:00pm Fri 24th July. Go to http://t.co/hkse3oxFP5 to have your say!
Further representations can now be made, until 24th July, on initial comments on the draft ID Plan.  Have your say at http://t.co/u3KqOS9kuX
Deadline update! Comments on the draft Island Development Plan will now be accepted until midnight on Monday 13th April. Keep them coming!
Over 180 people attended our draft Island Development Plan drop-in at Le Friquet Garden Centre on Saturday; thank you to everyone who came.
After the success of our recent drop-ins on the draft Plan, a further session will be held tomorrow am at Le Friquet Garden Centre, 9-12
Two weeks left to have your say on the draft Island Development Plan! Find details on how to respond online at http://t.co/u3KqORRJDp
A successful talk to the CPD Club yesterday at Jerbourg Hotel re the draft Island Development Plan - thank you to all who attended
After the success of our recent drop-ins on the draft Plan, a further session will be held at Le Friquet, 9:00-12:00 on the 28th March
Over 250 people attended our draft Island Development Plan drop-in at Le Friquet Garden Centre on Saturday; thank you to everyone who came.
The second of our drop-in sessions is tomorrow at Le Friquet Garden Centre, 9.00-2.00 – pop by for info on the draft Plan and Public Inquiry
@oldfarmhorace Any probs in interpreting the draft Plan, please contact planreview@gov.gg, 717200 or pop to us & we'll be happy to help
@oldfarmhorace @PlanReviewGsy
Thanks to all who visited us at Earlswood on Sat - a great turn out and interesting points raised. Looking forward to the Friquet next Sat
Drop-in: staff will be at Earlswood Garden Centre tomorrow to answer questions on the draft Plan & Public Inquiry - pop in between 9 & 2.
The draft Island Development Plan was published yesterday - go to http://t.co/NkwBDM9s8P to view the documents and find out how to comment
The draft Island Development Plan will be published 16 Feb '15.  Info to be available at http://t.co/G2FpFondPh and http://t.co/hkse3og4Xx.
Publication date of draft Island Development Plan is now revised to February 2015: http://t.co/KbLYk1Ny5V
Hard at work to get the draft Island Development Plan out for public consultation this autumn - keep your eyes peeled for further updates!
Congratulations to all those who won prizes at the Design Awards.  Another important showcase of what Guernsey has to offer!
Only a few days left to vote on the Design Awards - go to http://t.co/weTW73kfLY to choose!  Last date 19th March, awards on 3rd April!
Pick your favourite entry in the Guernsey Design Awards!  View entries at Frossard House or http://t.co/weTW73kfLY to vote by 19th March.
The draft Island Development Plan will be published by early summer, with a public Enquiry by autumn 2014:  http://t.co/WEri78AtXE
RT @VisitGuernsey: Well done Aurigny! Claiming the title of world’s best short-haul airline after passengers vote in a @WhichUK survey! htt…
Report on the 2nd stage Consultation for the Island Development Plan now available on http://t.co/VsJQfMZy5D
Latest housing and employment land monitoring now available at http://t.co/Vrju0E8qd6
Thanks to everyone who attended our Employment Land Focus Group yesterday - a really valuable contribution to the Plan
Delighted to see community-led Visions for St PP & The Bridge launched yesterday. http://t.co/kBAylEAIey
RT @itvchanneltv: BREAKING: & the bridge.. Their ideas.. building a brand new ferry terminal and putting underground car parking in town.. …
The Call for Sites closed on the 13th Sept; the Department is processing the submissions and will acknowledge each in writing in due course.
Thanks for all your responses to the latest Plan Review consultation (now closed) which will be considered in drafting new Dev Plan policies
Final reminder that consultation on Key Messages, Issues & Options, including Call for Sites ends this Friday http://t.co/VsJQfMZy5D
We'll be accepting your emailed & written comments and call for sites submissions on the Plan Review up to 13th Sept - keep them coming!
Thanks to everyone who made it to our drop-in sessions; you can still speak to us at Sir Charles Frossard House right up to the 13th Sept.
The Call for Sites forms and guidance note are available on our webpage at http://t.co/VsJQfMZy5D
Thanks to everyone who came to today's drop-in session in Western Parishes Community Centre; tomorrow we are in Quayside, Vale from 9am-5pm.
Drop in to one of our Plan Review update sessions over the next 2 weeks. Come and have your say! More details at http://t.co/CHEfdPxS5h.
Plan Review: the next public consultation will run for 7 weeks from 29 July. Have your say by 13 Sept! Details at http://t.co/CHEfdPxS5h
Following coverage of June’s CPD Club, the next public consultation stage will be from the end of July to mid September. Details to follow.
Thursday's CPD Club talk on the Development Plan Review saw a great turn out!  Thanks to all who came along, we hope it was informative :)
Sign up for next CPD Club members event on 13 June for an update on the Development Plan Review http://t.co/ik727vY6nx
Guernsey's Coastal Defence Strategy has been approved by the Environment Department Board and will be debated at the July States meeting.
Website update! The Plan Review page has been updated to advise of the current status. Go to http://t.co/G2FpFo5CqH to find out more!
The Visioning Team have written the first draft of the Town Vision and are working on the draft vision for The Bridge.
Future electricity supply options are being explored by GE, see http://t.co/F9ebjE0Qmg for more details
Update: public consultation on the next stage of the review of Guernsey's development plans is expected to take place during the summer
The Housing Needs Survey 2011 was released today by the Housing Department. For the press release and full survey go to http://t.co/05rqBh61

@GollopGuern 

Representatives bring a lot to the table and always add value to such work.
RT @GollopGuern: @PlanReviewGsy why are elected representatives not more involved with this work or do we not bring anything to the table?
Good meeting yesterday for the Retail Strategy Group. Work is progressing well towards a draft Strategy for the Island
Very interesting Studies released about the Islands Coastal Defence from flooding, Read studies on http://t.co/EieDNX7x and have your say
Good meeting with John, Contact Magazine - look out for their article on the Plan Review and its current workstreams in the next edition!
Here's the link to the article: http://t.co/tpThPwT7@PlanReviewGsy
Thanks Trevor Cooper for your superb article about our consultation report in yesterday's Press. http://t.co/Ay7KVNHq
RT @Guernsey_Market: It's the Customer Service Awards on Friday at 5pm in Market Square. Make sure you attend if you are nominated #Guernsey
#Monocle's most liveable cities are beautiful, elegantly mature & surrounded by water, remind you of anywhere?
Thanks to #Guernseypress for covering Tuesday's Visioning Event to let everyone know the key issues we discussed
We asked 100 people in Town where they had just come from: 32 had come from work, 34 from home and 21 from visitor accommodation or a boat
We asked 100 people how they got into Town that lunchtime: 65 walked, 15 drove, 13got the bus, 3 got a lift, 1 cycled, 1 got a taxi
And here's the Vision that another group came up with for The Bridge in 2025. http://t.co/q24mVk8Q
Took part in a really positive Visioning Event y'ay for Town and The Bridge.  Here's our group's vision. What's yours? http://t.co/0gTdXcUV
A view on the true cost of 'free' parking. http://t.co/vrYATpwo via @grist
RT @indy_johar: RT @wadhwa: No doubt, when it comes to successful startups, old guys (and gals) rule: http://t.co/5jOs4lqv  :)
RT @GdnLocalGov: 'It's not enough just to define your vision, your staff have to believe in it too' - http://t.co/bACrP250 #localgov
Preparations are well underway for the Visioning Workshop, which is shaping up to be great event next Tuesday 26th at Trinity Church
It'd be great if you could fill out (anonymously) our on-line survey on requirements for industrial premises at https://t.co/WBR1opyI
Check out this SlideShare presentation : 20 things you can do on the high street with... http://t.co/VUYdcfcg
What do you like best about Town and the Bridge?  The Plan Review team would love to know!
If you could improve one aspect of Town and/or the Bridge what would it be?  How?  Let us know what you think!
Thank you for your comments. Look out for a downloadable summary on the States website in July.
If you have any comments to make on the topic papers - the deadline has been extended to Friday 23rd March http://t.co/BVvOaezT
Don't forget to send in your comments on planning's big issues by the 16th March - reponse forms can be downloaded here http://t.co/BVvOaezT
RT @gollopguern: Drat! Foiled again as I arrive too late for St.Martins Planning roadshow but plan review online & on twitter@planreviewgsy.
Come along tomorrow to speak to us about how Guernsey might develop in the future or respond online http://t.co/BVvOaezT
Sat 25th Feb 10am-12.30pm we're at St Martin's Community Centre for the last (in this round of consultation) Plan Review info session
Listen out for us on @BBCGuernsey this morning - we're at Le Friquet from 10am today, come along for advice & info http://t.co/BVvOaezT
Thanks @argyllscricket, we like it too :)
We're on @BBCGuernsey discussing the Plan Review info session (& planning advice surgery) at Le Friquet on Sat http://t.co/ZdyRcfEW
Guernsey News from ITV Channel Television: Islanders offered advice on planning process http://t.co/25QyHhWN Thanks @channelonline
Some interesting points on the Topic Paper 'A Sustainable Approach' http://t.co/KKmt0bf2 Thanks @MusingUrbanist
Thanks to everyone who has been in touch with us. Remember, you can register for Plan Review email updates, contact planreview@gov.gg
We're at the inner Market until 1pm, come and talk to us!
Great information session today, thanks to everyone who came along, really useful comments. We're at the inner market again tomorrow 9am-1pm
Come along to our Plan Review information sessions at the innner market buildings, St Peter Port this week(19 Jan 1pm-5pm & 20 Jan 9am-1pm)
Review of the Urban and Rural Area Plans starts today, go to http://t.co/FFdRfQeA for more information on the Big Issues
